intro: Bancroftia decipiens, commonly known as the African daisy, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers that bloom in shades of yellow and orange. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often covered in fine hairs. Bancroftia decipiens is adapted to dry climates and is often found in savannas and rocky areas.
